MainClaim.text: "Heidegger presides over an occlusion of the political in his thought

s conception of the political as a threa.text: "The dominant characterization of the political space within Heidegger's text is as a threat to philosophy and ontology."

s strategies to deal with the threat of.text: "Heidegger employs three strategies to deal with the threat of the political: disengagement

s presentation of the political as a thr.text: "The political is characterized as a threat to philosophy and ontology

s failure to recognize the political as.text: "Heidegger's failure to recognize the economic and political as a reality with a logic and laws of its own is a key aspect of his occlusion of the political."

s treatment of authenticity as an ontolo.text: "Heidegger's treatment of authenticity exemplifies a process whereby what are loosely ethical norms become gradually reinterpreted as ontological norms."

s privileging of ontology over ethics an.text: "Heidegger's thought prioritizes ontology over ethics and politics."

s anti-Semitism and its relation to his.text: "Heidegger's anti-Semitism makes the occlusion of the political by the ontological more visible

s failure to address the charge of occlu.text: "Heidegger's Schwarze Hefte serve to undermine his response to the charge that he allows ontology to occlude ethics and politics."

s prioritization of thinking on Being.text: "Heidegger suggests that thinking on Being has explanatory priority over other forms of action."

s anti-Semitic views and the problem of.text: "Heidegger's anti-Semitic views create a problem for his transcendental justification of prioritizing ontological relations."

s view of philosophy and its relation to.text: "Heidegger's view of philosophy is that it is an activity that sustains a distinctive relationship to Being."

s conception of authenticity.text: "Heidegger's conception of authenticity is closely tied to his view of the good life and the importance of maintaining an appropriate relationship to Being."

s prioritization of authenticity.text: "Heidegger prioritizes authenticity as a necessary condition for doing good philosophy."

s view of the good life.text: "Heidegger's view of the good life is closely tied to his conception of authenticity and the importance of maintaining an appropriate relationship to Being."

s conception of the political.text: "Heidegger's conception of the political is characterized by a threat and a suppression of the political by the ontological."

s failure to address the question of the.text: "Heidegger's thought fails to address the question of the political in a sustained way."

s failure to recognize the complexity of.text: "Heidegger's thought fails to recognize the complexity of the political

s prioritization of authenticity over ot.text: "Heidegger prioritizes authenticity over other values such as power and desire."

s view of the relationship between philo.text: "Heidegger's view of the relationship between philosophy and politics is characterized by a suppression of the political by the ontological."

s prioritization of ontology over ethics.text: "Heidegger prioritizes ontology over ethics and politics."
